intro: Tephroseris papposa, commonly known as the silky tephroseris, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, aided by the silky, pappus-like structures attached to each seed. Tephroseris papposa is often found in coastal and arid regions, where it adapts well to harsh environmental conditions.
